spec.description: The specification of the Kafka Connect Source-to-Image (S2I) cluster.

accessToken.description: Link to Kubernetes Secret containing the access token which was obtained from the authorization server.

key.description: The key under which the secret value is stored in the Kubernetes Secret.

secretName.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret containing the secret value.

accessTokenIsJwt.description: Configure whether access token should be treated as JWT. This should be set to `false` if the authorization server returns opaque tokens. Defaults to `true`.

certificateAndKey.description: Reference to the `Secret` which holds the certificate and private key pair.

certificate.description: The name of the file certificate in the Secret.

key.description: The name of the private key in the Secret.

secretName.description: The name of the Secret containing the certificate.

clientId.description: OAuth Client ID which the Kafka client can use to authenticate against the OAuth server and use the token endpoint URI.

clientSecret.description: Link to Kubernetes Secret containing the OAuth client secret which the Kafka client can use to authenticate against the OAuth server and use the token endpoint URI.

key.description: The key under which the secret value is stored in the Kubernetes Secret.

secretName.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret containing the secret value.

disableTlsHostnameVerification.description: Enable or disable TLS hostname verification. Default value is `false`.

maxTokenExpirySeconds.description: Set or limit time-to-live of the access tokens to the specified number of seconds. This should be set if the authorization server returns opaque tokens.

passwordSecret.description: Reference to the `Secret` which holds the password.

password.description: The name of the key in the Secret under which the password is stored.

secretName.description: The name of the Secret containing the password.

refreshToken.description: Link to Kubernetes Secret containing the refresh token which can be used to obtain access token from the authorization server.

key.description: The key under which the secret value is stored in the Kubernetes Secret.

secretName.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret containing the secret value.

scope.description: OAuth scope to use when authenticating against the authorization server. Some authorization servers require this to be set. The possible values depend on how authorization server is configured. By default `scope` is not specified when doing the token endpoint request.

tlsTrustedCertificates.description: Trusted certificates for TLS connection to the OAuth server.

certificate.description: The name of the file certificate in the Secret.

secretName.description: The name of the Secret containing the certificate.

type.description: Authentication type. Currently the only supported types are `tls`, `scram-sha-512`, and `plain`. `scram-sha-512` type uses SASL SCRAM-SHA-512 Authentication. `plain` type uses SASL PLAIN Authentication. `oauth` type uses SASL OAUTHBEARER Authentication. The `tls` type uses TLS Client Authentication. The `tls` type is supported only over TLS connections.

bootstrapServers.description: Bootstrap servers to connect to. This should be given as a comma separated list of _<hostname>_:‍_<port>_ pairs.

build.description: Configures how the Connect container image should be built. Optional.

output.description: Configures where should the newly built image be stored. Required.

image.description: The name of the image which will be built. Required.

pushSecret.description: Container Registry Secret with the credentials for pushing the newly built image.

type.description: Output type. Must be either `docker` for pushing the newly build image to Docker compatible registry or `imagestream` for pushing the image to OpenShift ImageStream. Required.

plugins.description: List of connector plugins which should be added to the Kafka Connect. Required.

artifacts.description: List of artifacts which belong to this connector plugin. Required.

sha512sum.description: SHA512 checksum of the artifact. Optional. If specified, the checksum will be verified while building the new container. If not specified, the downloaded artifact will not be verified.

type.description: Artifact type. Currently, the supported artifact types are `tgz` and `jar`.

url.description: URL of the artifact which will be downloaded. Strimzi does not do any security scanning of the downloaded artifacts. For security reasons, you should first verify the artifacts manually and configure the checksum verification to make sure the same artifact is used in the automated build. Required.

name.description: The unique name of the connector plugin. Will be used to generate the path where the connector artifacts will be stored. The name has to be unique within the KafkaConnect resource. The name has to follow the following pattern: `^[a-z][-_a-z0-9]*[a-z]$`. Required.

resources.description: CPU and memory resources to reserve for the build.

buildResources.description: CPU and memory resources to reserve.

clientRackInitImage.description: The image of the init container used for initializing the `client.rack`.

config.description: The Kafka Connect configuration. Properties with the following prefixes cannot be set: ssl., sasl., security., listeners, plugin.path, rest., bootstrap.servers, consumer.interceptor.classes, producer.interceptor.classes (with the exception of: ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm, ssl.cipher.suites, ssl.protocol, ssl.enabled.protocols).

externalConfiguration.description: Pass data from Secrets or ConfigMaps to the Kafka Connect pods and use them to configure connectors.

env.description: Allows to pass data from Secret or ConfigMap to the Kafka Connect pods as environment variables.

name.description: Name of the environment variable which will be passed to the Kafka Connect pods. The name of the environment variable cannot start with `KAFKA_` or `STRIMZI_`.

valueFrom.description: Value of the environment variable which will be passed to the Kafka Connect pods. It can be passed either as a reference to Secret or ConfigMap field. The field has to specify exactly one Secret or ConfigMap.

configMapKeyRef.description: Reference to a key in a ConfigMap.

secretKeyRef.description: Reference to a key in a Secret.

volumes.description: Allows to pass data from Secret or ConfigMap to the Kafka Connect pods as volumes.

configMap.description: Reference to a key in a ConfigMap. Exactly one Secret or ConfigMap has to be specified.

name.description: Name of the volume which will be added to the Kafka Connect pods.

secret.description: Reference to a key in a Secret. Exactly one Secret or ConfigMap has to be specified.

image.description: The docker image for the pods.

insecureSourceRepository.description: When true this configures the source repository with the 'Local' reference policy and an import policy that accepts insecure source tags.

-XX.description: A map of -XX options to the JVM.

gcLoggingEnabled.description: Specifies whether the Garbage Collection logging is enabled. The default is false.

javaSystemProperties.description: A map of additional system properties which will be passed using the `-D` option to the JVM.

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Defaults to 3. Minimum value is 1.

initialDelaySeconds.description: The initial delay before first the health is first checked. Default to 15 seconds. Minimum value is 0.

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Default to 10 seconds. Minimum value is 1.

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Defaults to 1. Must be 1 for liveness. Minimum value is 1.

timeoutSeconds.description: The timeout for each attempted health check. Default to 5 seconds. Minimum value is 1.

loggers.description: A Map from logger name to logger level.

name.description: The name of the `ConfigMap` from which to get the logging configuration.

type.description: Logging type, must be either 'inline' or 'external'.

metrics.description: The Prometheus JMX Exporter configuration. See https://github.com/prometheus/jmx_exporter for details of the structure of this configuration.

valueFrom.description: ConfigMap where the Prometheus JMX Exporter configuration is stored. For details of the structure of this configuration, see the {JMXExporter}.

configMapKeyRef.description: Reference to the key in the ConfigMap containing the metrics configuration.

rack.description: Configuration of the node label which will be used as the client.rack consumer configuration.

topologyKey.description: A key that matches labels assigned to the Kubernetes cluster nodes. The value of the label is used to set the broker's `broker.rack` config and `client.rack` in Kafka Connect.

failureThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Defaults to 3. Minimum value is 1.

initialDelaySeconds.description: The initial delay before first the health is first checked. Default to 15 seconds. Minimum value is 0.

periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Default to 10 seconds. Minimum value is 1.

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Defaults to 1. Must be 1 for liveness. Minimum value is 1.

timeoutSeconds.description: The timeout for each attempted health check. Default to 5 seconds. Minimum value is 1.

replicas.description: The number of pods in the Kafka Connect group.

resources.description: The maximum limits for CPU and memory resources and the requested initial resources.

template.description: Template for Kafka Connect and Kafka Connect S2I resources. The template allows users to specify how the `Deployment`, `Pods` and `Service` are generated.

annotations.description: Annotations added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

labels.description: Labels added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

buildConfig.description: Template for the Kafka Connect BuildConfig used to build new container images. The BuildConfig is used only on OpenShift.

annotations.description: Annotations added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

labels.description: Labels added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

buildContainer.description: Template for the Kafka Connect Build container. The build container is used only on Kubernetes.

env.description: Environment variables which should be applied to the container.

buildPod.description: Template for Kafka Connect Build `Pods`. The build pod is used only on Kubernetes.

hostAliases.description: The pod's HostAliases. HostAliases is an optional list of hosts and IPs that will be injected into the pod's hosts file if specified.

imagePullSecrets.description: List of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any of the images used by this Pod. When the `STRIMZI_IMAGE_PULL_SECRETS` environment variable in Cluster Operator and the `imagePullSecrets` option are specified, only the `imagePullSecrets` variable is used and the `STRIMZI_IMAGE_PULL_SECRETS` variable is ignored.

annotations.description: Annotations added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

labels.description: Labels added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

priorityClassName.description: The name of the priority class used to assign priority to the pods. For more information about priority classes, see {K8sPriorityClass}.

schedulerName.description: The name of the scheduler used to dispatch this `Pod`. If not specified, the default scheduler will be used.

securityContext.description: Configures pod-level security attributes and common container settings.

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal, and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value to longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. Value must be a non-negative integer. A zero value indicates delete immediately. You might need to increase the grace period for very large Kafka clusters, so that the Kafka brokers have enough time to transfer their work to another broker before they are terminated. Defaults to 30 seconds.

connectContainer.description: Template for the Kafka Connect container.

env.description: Environment variables which should be applied to the container.

deploymentStrategy.description: DeploymentStrategy which will be used for this Deployment. Valid values are `RollingUpdate` and `Recreate`. Defaults to `RollingUpdate`.

annotations.description: Annotations added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

labels.description: Labels added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

initContainer.description: Template for the Kafka init container.

env.description: Environment variables which should be applied to the container.

hostAliases.description: The pod's HostAliases. HostAliases is an optional list of hosts and IPs that will be injected into the pod's hosts file if specified.

imagePullSecrets.description: List of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any of the images used by this Pod. When the `STRIMZI_IMAGE_PULL_SECRETS` environment variable in Cluster Operator and the `imagePullSecrets` option are specified, only the `imagePullSecrets` variable is used and the `STRIMZI_IMAGE_PULL_SECRETS` variable is ignored.

annotations.description: Annotations added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

labels.description: Labels added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

priorityClassName.description: The name of the priority class used to assign priority to the pods. For more information about priority classes, see {K8sPriorityClass}.

schedulerName.description: The name of the scheduler used to dispatch this `Pod`. If not specified, the default scheduler will be used.

securityContext.description: Configures pod-level security attributes and common container settings.

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal, and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value to longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. Value must be a non-negative integer. A zero value indicates delete immediately. You might need to increase the grace period for very large Kafka clusters, so that the Kafka brokers have enough time to transfer their work to another broker before they are terminated. Defaults to 30 seconds.

maxUnavailable.description: Maximum number of unavailable pods to allow automatic Pod eviction. A Pod eviction is allowed when the `maxUnavailable` number of pods or fewer are unavailable after the eviction. Setting this value to 0 prevents all voluntary evictions, so the pods must be evicted manually. Defaults to 1.

metadata.description: Metadata to apply to the `PodDistruptionBugetTemplate` resource.

annotations.description: Annotations added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

labels.description: Labels added to the resource template. Can be applied to different resources such as `StatefulSets`, `Deployments`, `Pods`, and `Services`.

certificate.description: The name of the file certificate in the Secret.

secretName.description: The name of the Secret containing the certificate.

tracing.description: The configuration of tracing in Kafka Connect.

type.description: Type of the tracing used. Currently the only supported type is `jaeger` for Jaeger tracing.

version.description: The Kafka Connect version. Defaults to {DefaultKafkaVersion}. Consult the user documentation to understand the process required to upgrade or downgrade the version.

status.description: The status of the Kafka Connect Source-to-Image (S2I) cluster.

buildConfigName.description: The name of the build configuration.

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition of a type changed from one status to another. The required format is 'yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ', in the UTC time zone.

message.description: Human-readable message indicating details about the condition's last transition.

reason.description: The reason for the condition's last transition (a single word in CamelCase).

status.description: The status of the condition, either True, False or Unknown.

type.description: The unique identifier of a condition, used to distinguish between other conditions in the resource.

connectorPlugins.description: The list of connector plugins available in this Kafka Connect deployment.

class.description: The class of the connector plugin.

type.description: The type of the connector plugin. The available types are `sink` and `source`.

version.description: The version of the connector plugin.

labelSelector.description: Label selector for pods providing this resource.

observedGeneration.description: The generation of the CRD that was last reconciled by the operator.

replicas.description: The current number of pods being used to provide this resource.

url.description: The URL of the REST API endpoint for managing and monitoring Kafka Connect connectors.
